network.name: AirPennNet-Help
network.welcome_title: Welcome to the//University of Pennsylvania Network
network.unsupported_os_message: Your operating system is not currently supported for automated configuration. Please contact your LSP or ITA for manual configuration instructions.

contact.message: For assistance connecting to AirPennNet, please contact your Local Support Provider (LSP) or Information Technology Advisor (ITA). For assistance locating your LSP or ITA, please see: http://www.upenn.edu/computing/

network_item.name: Student
network_item.description: Select this network profile if you are a student.
network_item.pre_credential_text: Your PennKey and Password are required to access this network.
network_item.authentication_assistance: Your PennKey and Password are required to access this network.

setting.incorrect_text: Windows Automatic Update Service (WAUS) needs to be installed.
setting.when_repaired_text: Windows Automatic Update Service (WAUS) was installed.
setting.install_text:
Windows Automatic Update Service (WAUS)
To help ensure your computer stays current with security patches, Penn offers a service that automatically downloads and installs updates to your computer. The Windows Automatic Update Service (WAUS) helps protect your computer from being compromised by very destructive worms and hackers that are not caught by conventional antivirus software.
setting.uninstall_text: While accessing this network, Windows Automatic Update Service (WAUS) was installed. It is recommended that you leave this software installed.

setting.incorrect_text: SecureW2 Enterprise Client 3.5.9 needs to be installed.
setting.install_text: SecureW2 Enterprise Client version 3.5.9 is required to access the network. Click 'Install' to start the installation of SecureW2 version 3.5.9.
setting.uninstall_text: SecureW2 was installed to access this network. This is commonly used software. As such, it is recommended that you leave the software installed. Click 'Skip' to leave it installed or 'Uninstall' to uninstall it.

setting.incorrect_text: Root CA 'UTN-USERFirst-Hardware' needs to be installed.
setting.help_link: show: ${FILE_LOCATION};A root certificate authority needs configured for this network.////1. The certificate should open in a separate form automatically. If not, locate the file ${FILE_LOCATION} and double-click on it. //2. At the bottom of the form, click 'Install Certificate'. //3. Click 'Next'. //4. Click 'Next'. //5. Click 'Finish'. //6. Click 'Yes'. //7. A message should appear stating the import was successful. //8. Click 'Ok' to close the certificate form. ////The certificate is now installed.

When prompted to allow access to the keyring, please select "Always Allow".
Please select your affiliation:
Your operating system or network interface type is not supported. If you think this is in error, click 'Retry' to reevaluate your machine.
Your computer is now configured for AirPennNet, but we were unable to disconnect the network interface while attempting to reconnect.

Your computer is now configured for AirPennNet, but we were unable to reconnect the network interface. Most likely, the interface is in a disabled state. Open 'Network Connections' and ensure that your network interface is enabled.

A successful authentication did not occur during the allotted time. This is typically caused by an incorrect PennKey user name or password or because a non-Microsoft wireless utility is causing a conflict.
An IP address was not acquired within the allotted time. Click 'Retry' to try again.
We failed to verify that the connection is working properly. Click 'Retry' to try again. Click 'Skip' to proceed without verification.

The network card '${PHYSICAL_NIC_NAME}' does not appear to support the required encryption settings. Please check the manufacturers website for an updated driver or contact Local Support Provider (LSP) or Information Technology Advisor (ITA) for assistance.////${NIC_DETAILS}
Search For New Driver
[DRIVER_SEARCH]
A successful authentication did not occur. Verify your user name and password and click 'Continue' to try again.

Your computer is now properly configured for the network, but we failed to associate to the SSID '${SSID}'. Please ensure that you are within range of the wireless network.////To connect to the network, you may either://1. Click the wireless network icon in the system tray to open the 'Choose a Wireless Network' screen. Then, select the '${SSID}' network and click 'Connect'.//2. Reboot your computer. Afterwards, your computer should automatically connect to the wireless network.////If it still does not associate to the wireless network, please verify that non-Microsoft wireless utilities, particularly applications provided by '${NIC_PROVIDER}', are turned off. If the problem persists, you may need to update the driver for your wireless card. To try again, click 'Retry' below.
Your PennKey user name is not correctly formatted.

The network card '${PHYSICAL_NIC_NAME}' does not appear to support the required physical type (PHY_TYPE) settings for the wireless network. It may be necessary to purchase a new network card to access this wireless network. Please contact the help desk for assistance.////${NIC_DETAILS}
Authentication failed.

The wireless network is now configured but a successful authentication was not detected. To manually change your username or password, click on the wireless icon, then right click on the network '${SSID}' and select properties. To manually connect to the wireless network, click on the Wi-Fi icon and select '${SSID}'.
